entry.id: Issues with the allocation of funds from Vivus, Mexico - 2023-08-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Issues with the allocation of funds from Vivus, Mexico
entry.content: Income Marketplace reported that the allocated funds from Vivus have been carried out prematurely due to data discrepancies. The team has been rolling back the transfers, which may have resulted in negative balances on customer accounts. The platform is working on resolving the issues.

entry.id: InRento's mailing system is being mantained - 2023-08-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento's mailing system is being mantained
entry.content: Due to the scheduled mailing service maintenance, investors might be experiencing issues with email notifications. The system should by updated by the end of next business week.

entry.id: PeerBerry has launched a news section - 2023-08-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry has launched a news section
entry.content: The p2p lending marketplace launched a notification feature for its desktop version.

entry.title: Crowdpear launched a news section
entry.content: The crowdlending platform launched a notification feature for its desktop version.

entry.id: Esketit shares information about how to handle potential investment risk - 2023-08-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Esketit shares information about how to handle potential investment risk
entry.content: Esketit released a statement about how the platform aims to deal with potential investment risk. In a follow-up message, the CEO confirmed that, currently, there is nothing that investors should be worried about. The platform is proactive to ensure that if certain risks materialize, they are being handled according to investors' expectations.

entry.id: Lendermarket allows the investment of "pending payments" - 2023-08-05T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Lendermarket allows the investment of "pending payments"
entry.content: The P2P marketplace enables investors to invest pending payments in the currently available loans. Pending payments are funds that are not available for withdrawal as the platform doesn't dispose of the funds.

entry.id: Celsius founder Alex Mashinsky arrested and charged with fraud - 2023-07-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Celsius founder Alex Mashinsky arrested and charged with fraud
entry.content: Alex Mashinsky, the founder of bankrupt cryptocurrency lender Celsius Network, has been arrested by US authorities and charged with fraud and market manipulation.

entry.id: PeerBerry repaid €42.65 M in war-affected loans - 2023-07-17T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry repaid €42.65 M in war-affected loans
entry.content: PeerBerry's business partners repaid another €1,8 M in war-affected loans from Ukraine and Russia. PeerBerry business partners have already repaid EUR 42,65 million, or 85% of the total war-affected obligations towards PeerBerry investors.

entry.id: Vivus Mexico is moving to a new direct listing structure - 2023-07-17T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Vivus Mexico is moving to a new direct listing structure
entry.content: The Mexican lending company Vivus will be listing short-term loans from Mexico under a new direct listing structure. This process has taken more time than anticipated, mainly due to IT bottlenecks on Vivus' side, and it looks like it will not be resolved in the very near future. Vivus won't be listing any new loans until the new structure is in place. The lender informed the Income Marketplace that it will clear all late loans by the 21. July 2023.

entry.id: rethink-p2p reports about the questionable practices of the failed p2p platform Credon and the connection to Hive5 - 2023-07-19T00:00:00Z
entry.title: rethink-p2p reports about the questionable practices of the failed p2p platform Credon and the connection to Hive5
entry.content: The German rethink-p2p.de page reports on the harmful practices of Credon and the connection of the shareholder to Hive5's business partner. The Croatian Hive5 platform is threatening to take legal action against the author of rethink-p2p.de for the revelations of questionable practices by the shareholder of Credon and business partner of Hive5, Juozas Rupšys.

entry.title: Lendermarket introduced "pending payments"
entry.content: When a Loan Originator notifies Lendermarket of a borrower's repayment, a "Pending Payment" status is assigned. At this point, Lendermarket has only received notice of the upcoming transfer. Lendermarket is still waiting for the Loan Originator to complete the transfer to Lendermarket.

entry.title: Capitalia will withold 20% income tax
entry.content: Starting from the 1st of September of this year, Capitalia will deduct a 20% personal income tax from the income received by investors - interest and late payment fees. Going forward, investors will receive the full principal amount of their loans and 80% of the total interest and late payment fees.

entry.id: Heavy Finance received the ECSP license - 2023-07-26T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Heavy Finance received the ECSP license
entry.content: Heavy Finance received the European Service Providers licenses issued by the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA). This license provides enhanced investor protection.

entry.title: Crowdpear received the ESCP license
entry.content: Crowdpear became an EU-level regulated crowdfunding platform that enables the platform to provide services throughout the EU.

entry.id: Reinvest24 replaced management in Spain due to poor portfolio performance - 2023-07-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Reinvest24 replaced management in Spain due to poor portfolio performance
entry.content: Reinvest24 is undergoing several changes in its Spanish branch. The management and its business partners, such as the construction company and real estate agency, are about to be replaced. As a result of the ongoing challenges, Reinvest24 has stopped listing investment opportunities from Spain until the portfolio quality is improved.

entry.title: Cash Drag on Income
entry.content: Income Marketplace reports low loan availability due to the season and changes in investment structures from larger lending companies. Investors should explore other top-rated platforms to get their funds invested.

entry.id: Debitum changes owners and removes DEB token features - 2023-07-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Debitum changes owners and removes DEB token features
entry.content: The legal entity behind Debitum platform, DN Operator changes ownership from Mārtiņš Liberts to Henrijs Jansons, Ingus Salmiņš and Ēriks Reņģītis. The former management of Debitum Network raised over € 6 Million worth of DEB tokens to fund the platform's development. The new leadership distances itself from the DEB token and removes it from the platform, claiming the legal entity behind Debitum platform doesn't have any connection to the Token Generation Event conducted by the previous management.
